M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.GetClosestStation Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Calculates the alignment station closest to the given model point.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.Get(Element) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Returns an Alignment object given a Revit alignment element.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel.AlignmentId Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: The ElementId of the Alignment on which the SpotDimension is placed.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.DisplayedStartStation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Specifies the station at which the alignment's display starts, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: This station is within the alignment's geometric definition range (StartStation, EndStation).

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.GetClosestPoint Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Calculates the point on the alignment's geometry which is closest to the given model point.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel.GetAlignmentStationLabels(Alignment) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Returns all alignment station labels placed on the given alignment.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: The resulting collection may contain both "individual" labels (created via Create(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelOptions)) and "labels in set" (created via CreateSet(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions)). These labels have categories respectively OST_Alignments and OST_AlignmentStationLabelSets.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel.IsValid(Element) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Checks if the element is a valid alignment station label.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel.Station Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: The alignment station at which the SpotDimension is placed.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Represents an object containing options for creating a set of AlignmentStationLabel.

props.d:
The ending station for creating labels in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.
               When null, the station value corresponding to the alignment's DisplayedEndStation is used.

Specifies if the label will have a leader. 
               The default value is true.

The interval between labels to be created in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.
               When null, a predefined interval value will be used, depending on the unit setting for stationing units in the document.
               For standard imperial, the default is 100 ft.
               For survey imperial, the default is 100 USft (US survey).
               For metric, the default is 1000 m.

The offset of the labels from the alignment, in Revit internal paper space units (standard Imperial feet).
               A positive offset creates labels to the right of the alignment, a negative - to the left.
               The default value is null.
               If null, a predefined offset value will be used, depending on the unit setting for stationing units in the document.
               For standard imperial, the default is 1/8".
               For survey imperial, the default is 1/8" (US survey).
               For metric, the default is 5 mm.

The starting station for creating labels in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.
               When null, the station value corresponding to the alignment's DisplayedStartStation is used.

Specifies the ElementId of the labels' type.
               The default value is InvalidElementId. in this case, CreateSet(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions) will throw an exception.

methods.d: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.(Inherited from Object)
Serves as the default hash function.(Inherited from Object)
Gets the Type of the current instance.(Inherited from Object)
Returns a string that represents the current object.(Inherited from Object)

The ending station for creating labels in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.

Specifies if the label will have a leader. 
               The default value is true.

The interval between labels to be created in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.
               When null, a predefined interval value will be used, depending on the unit setting for stationing units in the document.
               For standard imperial, the default is 100 ft.
               For survey imperial, the default is 100 USft (US survey).
               For metric, the default is 1000 m.

The offset of the labels from the alignment, in Revit internal paper space units (standard Imperial feet).
               A positive offset creates labels to the right of the alignment, a negative - to the left.
               The default value is null.
               If null, a predefined offset value will be used, depending on the unit setting for stationing units in the document.
               For standard imperial, the default is 1/8".
               For survey imperial, the default is 1/8" (US survey).
               For metric, the default is 5 mm.

The starting station for creating labels in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.
               When null, the station value corresponding to the alignment's DisplayedStartStation is used.

Specifies the ElementId of the labels' type.
               The default value is InvalidElementId. in this case, CreateSet(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions) will throw an exception.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.GetDistance Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Calculates the relative distance along the alignment between two stations based on their alignment distances
               according to Revit Internal Origin Coordinate Base. The distance may be positive or negative depending on
               the relative positions of the input stations on the alignment.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.GetPointAtStation Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Calculates the model point for a given alignment station.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelOptions.Station Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Specifies the station at which the label will be placed, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The station determines the location of the label's origin: Origin 
               by setting it to the closest point on the alignment geometry which corresponds to this station.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel.Element Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: The underlying SpotDimension element.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelOptions.HasLeader Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Specifies if the label will have a leader. 
               The default value is true.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel.CreateRecommendedTypeForSet Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Creates an element type recommended for alignment label sets and returns its ElementId.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: The crucial features of the label type recommended for sets are: - rotate with component - vertical text - label display includes station value - leader arrow head has type "Heavy End Tick Mark"

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Horiz.title: HorizontalCurveEndpoint.PreviousCurveType Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Horiz.desc:
The HorizontalCurveType 
               of the curve which connects the endpoint to the previous displayed curve.
               If this endpoint's Station equals 
               DisplayedStartStation, returns Unknown curve type.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions.TypeId Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Specifies the ElementId of the labels' type.
               The default value is InvalidElementId. in this case, CreateSet(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions) will throw an exception.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: Recommended types can be found using IsRecommendedTypeForSet(Element) Other valid types can be found using IsValidType(Element).

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.Element Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: The underlying DirectShape element.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Represents an object which provides access to a specialized Revit annotation element 
               used for labeling Alignment stations.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: The element is a SpotDimension. The element's category is OST_AlignmentStationLabels or, if in a set of labels, OST_AlignmentStationLabelSets. The element's type is a SpotDimensionType with DimensionStyleType equal to AlignmentStationLabel. The element's Origin is a point on the tessellated representation of an alignment. To get the precise point on the alignment's curve, use GetPointAtStation(Double) with input obtained from Station.

props.d: The ElementId of the Alignment on which the SpotDimension is placed.
The underlying SpotDimension element.
The alignment station at which the SpotDimension is placed.

methods.d:
Creates an AlignmentStationLabel object along with its underlying SpotDimension element. 
               Returns null if element creation fails.
Creates an element type recommended for alignment label sets and returns its ElementId.
Creates a collection of AlignmentStationLabel objects along with their underlying SpotDimension elements.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.(Inherited from Object)
Returns an AlignmentStationLabel object for the given element.
Returns all alignment station labels placed on the given alignment.
Returns all alignment station labels placed on the given alignment in the given view.
Serves as the default hash function.(Inherited from Object)
Gets the Type of the current instance.(Inherited from Object)
Checks if the element type is recommended for alignment labels in sets.
Checks if this object is a valid alignment station label.
Checks if the element is a valid alignment station label.
Checks if the type is a valid alignment station label type.
Returns a string that represents the current object.(Inherited from Object)

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions.StartStation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
The starting station for creating labels in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.
               When null, the station value corresponding to the alignment's DisplayedStartStation is used.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions.HasLeader Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Specifies if the label will have a leader. 
               The default value is true.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelOptions Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Represents an object containing options for creating an AlignmentStationLabel.

props.d:
Specifies if the label will have a leader. 
               The default value is true.

Specifies the leader end point, in model coordinates. 
               The default value is null.
               When null, the end point will be the same as the Origin point, 
               driven by the Station value.

Specifies the leader shoulder point, in model coordinates. 
               The default value is null.
               When null, the shoulder point will be the same as the Origin point, 
               driven by the Station value.

Specifies the station at which the label will be placed, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The station determines the location of the label's origin: Origin 
               by setting it to the closest point on the alignment geometry which corresponds to this station.

Specifies the ElementId of the label type. 
               The default value is InvalidElementId. In this case, the default type id for alignment station labels in the document is used.

methods.d: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current object.(Inherited from Object)
Serves as the default hash function.(Inherited from Object)
Gets the Type of the current instance.(Inherited from Object)
Returns a string that represents the current object.(Inherited from Object)

               For metric, the default is 5 mm.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: Can be used for finding types to be set to TypeId when creating alignment label sets with CreateSet(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions).

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabel.GetAlignmentStationLabels(Alignment, ElementId) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Returns all alignment station labels placed on the given alignment in the given view.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: The resulting collection may contain both "individual" labels (created via Create(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelOptions)) and "labels in set" (created via CreateSet(Alignment, View, AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions)). These labels have categories respectively OST_Alignments and OST_AlignmentStationLabelSets.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelOptions.LeaderShoulder Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Specifies the leader shoulder point, in model coordinates. 
               The default value is null.
               When null, the shoulder point will be the same as the Origin point, 
               driven by the Station value.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: Alignment.StartStation Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc: Specifies the station at which the alignment's geometric definition starts, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.remarks: This station may be outside the displayed range (DisplayedStartStation, DisplayedEndStation).

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelOptions.LeaderEnd Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
Specifies the leader end point, in model coordinates. 
               The default value is null.
               When null, the end point will be the same as the Origin point, 
               driven by the Station value.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.title: AlignmentStationLabelSetOptions.Interval Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.Infrastructure.Align.desc:
The interval between labels to be created in the set, in Revit internal model units (standard Imperial feet).
               The default value is null.
               When null, a predefined interval value will be used, depending on the unit setting for stationing units in the document.
               For standard imperial, the default is 100 ft.
               For survey imperial, the default is 100 USft (US survey).
               For metric, the default is 1000 m.
